div.p: There is no charge to submit a FOIA request -
but in certain instances, full FOIA processing may require a modest charge.
Although there is usually no charge for the first two hours of search time
and the first 100 pages of duplication,
agencies typically can charge for the time it takes to search for records
or for duplication of those records after the initial allotment runs out.
If you are seeking records for commercial use, you will be charged additional fees.
That said, you may always include in your request letter a statement
limiting the amount that you are willing to pay in fees.
Or you may request a waiver of fees.
Fee waivers are limited to situations in which you can show that
the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest.
That means it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding
of the operations and activities of the government.
